page.title: 19EMPLOYMENT CHANGES IN FORFAR
page.content: The grave stones in Forfar Parish Church show many{Weavers,}Tailors and Dyers.This is because Forfar was a very important town for making cloth. There used to be 3,000 weavers in Forfar making linen. The weaver's{pay}was just over a pound for a woman and just under 2 pounds for a man. The{hours}were very long:56 hours a week. Hooters were used to tell the workers it was time to get up,time for lunch or going home time.Most of the jute mills have now gone.The factory chimneys which were seen all over the town are gone as well.In their place are modern polypropylene factories, supermarkets and housing schemes.
